isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - WORK LIGHT W/O SLEEPER

svcproc.title: WORK LIGHT W/O SLEEPER
svcproc.para: When work light switch is moved to the position, power flows from the B2 battery stud through circuit 14T, fuse F2-A, circuit 65A, work light switch (441), and circuit 65B to the work light. The ground path is circuit 65-GB and 11-GAN to the trailer socket ground. With the work light switch in the position, power also flows from fuse F4-A through circuits 13V, 28A, work light indicator light, circuit 65C, work light switch, and circuits 65-GC and 11-GAN to trailer socket ground, thus indicating that the work light switch is turned ON.
